channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: BBCのティム・デイヴィー総局長は、2010年以降のBBCの予算削減は「近視眼的」であり、BBCの将来を損なう危険性があるとし、さらに2億ポンドの予算削減を発表した（Alexandra Topping/The Guardian）。
item.description:
Alexandra Topping / The Guardian:
BBC DG Tim Davie says the BBC's budget cuts since 2010 have been “shortsighted” and risked undermining its future, and announces a further £200M of budget cuts  —  Tim Davie says 14 years of reductions have put its future at risk, as he announces £200m of cuts

item.title: ションダ・ライムスのミニシリーズ『アンナを発明する』をめぐる、詐欺師アンナ・ソロキンの元友人によるNetflixに対する名誉毀損訴訟の続行を、米判事が認めた（Gene Maddaus/Variety）
item.description:
Gene Maddaus / Variety:
A US judge lets a defamation lawsuit against Netflix by a former friend of con artist Anna Sorokin over the Shonda Rhimes miniseries Inventing Anna proceed  —  A former friend of con artist Anna Sorokin was allowed on Tuesday to proceed with a defamation lawsuit against Netflix over the Shonda Rhimes miniseries, “Inventing Anna.”

item.title: 出典：カーリー・クロスが2023年後半に買収したi-D誌が、ロンドンで～10人、つまり編集部員のほとんどを解雇、編集者2人は残る（Lauren Sherman/@lapresmidi）
item.description:
Lauren Sherman / @lapresmidi:
Source: i-D magazine, which Karlie Kloss acquired in late 2023, lays off ~10 staff in London, or most of its editorial employees; two editors will remain  —  Scoop: i-D magazine, which was bought by Karlie Kloss late last year, laid off most of the editorial staff in London today — about 10 employees — global editorial director Olivia Singer and features editor Mahoro Seward are staying for now, I hear

item.title: 2024年2月15日までの1年間、米国の反トランス法に関するNYTの記事～65本を分析：66％がトランスの人物を引用しておらず、18％に誤報があった（Media Matters for America）
item.description:
Media Matters for America:
An analysis of ~65 NYT articles on US anti-trans legislation from the year to February 15, 2024: 66% did not quote a trans person, and 18% had misinformation  —  From February 15, 2023, through February 15, 2024, another 18% of such articles included anti-trans misinformation with no fact-checking

item.title: RIAA：2023年の米レコード音楽産業の売上は前年比8％増の171億ドル、有料会員収入は11％増の101億ドル、有料会員数は6％増の9,680万人（Murray Stassen/Music Business Worldwide）
item.description:
Murray Stassen / Music Business Worldwide:
RIAA: US recorded music industry revenues grew 8% YoY to $17.1B in 2023, with paid subscription revenues up 11% to $10.1B and paid subscriptions up 6% to 96.8M  —  The US recorded music industry generated $17.1 billion in 2023.  —  That's according to the Recording Industry Association of America …

item.title: NBCUニュース・グループ幹部は、MSNBCの大スターたちによるオンエアの反乱を受け、ロナ・マクダニエルの採用を撤回する際、彼らにできる唯一の決断を下した（David Zurawik/CNN）
item.description:
David Zurawik / CNN:
NBCU News Group executives made the only decision they could have when reversing Ronna McDaniel's hire, following the on-air revolt by MSNBC's biggest stars  —  Editor's Note: David Zurawik is a professor of practice in media studies at Goucher College.  For three decades, he was a media critic at the Baltimore Sun.

item.title: 元アリーナ・グループCEOロス・レヴィンソーンによる情報筋と訴訟の詳細は、アリーナ・グループによるスポーツ・イラストレイテッド誌の混乱した取り扱いと、ミニッツ・メディアへの厄介な移籍（A.J. Perez/Front Office Sports）
item.description:
A.J. Perez / Front Office Sports:
Sources and a lawsuit by ex-Arena Group CEO Ross Levinsohn detail The Arena Group's chaotic handling of Sports Illustrated and a messy transfer to Minute Media  —  - Sources say 5-Hour Energy tycoon Manoj Bhargava threatened to destroy the archives in a meeting with the new publishers of ‘SI.’

item.title: インドでNetflixやPrime Videoを打ち負かすDisney+ HotstarとJioCinemaの戦略に迫る。スポーツコンテンツや手頃な価格設定に注力するなど（Ananya Bhattacharya/Rest of World）
item.description:
Ananya Bhattacharya / Rest of World:
A look at Disney+ Hotstar's and JioCinema's strategy to beat Netflix and Prime Video in India, including by focusing on sports content and affordable pricing  —  Mukesh Ambani's Reliance and The Walt Disney Company have joined forces creating a hard-to-beat streaming entity in the country.

item.title: メモNBCUニュースグループ会長のセサール・コンデが、NBCがロナ・マクダニエルを有料寄稿者から外し、元RNC委員長を雇ったことを謝罪したことをスタッフに伝えた。
item.description:
Axios:
Memo: NBCU News Group Chair Cesar Conde tells staff NBC dropped Ronna McDaniel as a paid contributor and apologizes for hiring the former RNC chair  —  NBC has dropped Ronna McDaniel as a paid contributor, NBCU News Group Chair Cesar Conde confirmed in a memo to staff following backlash from some of the network's journalists.

item.title: 分析：2000年以降、ホワイトハウスの31人の報道官のうち16人が、テレビのニュース番組の有料寄稿者、コメンテーター、司会者になった。
item.description:
Axios:
Analysis: 16 of the White House's 31 press secretaries since 2000 have gone on to become paid contributors, commentators, or hosts on TV news programs  —  - Multiple networks scrambled to sign McDaniel when she left the RNC last month, despite her role in former President Trump's efforts …

item.title: AudibleがAmazon MGM Studiosと提携し、Audible OriginalsのコンテンツをベースにしたTVシリーズを共同制作、タイトルはPrime VideoやMGM+などに販売される（Cynthia Littleton/Variety）
item.description:
Cynthia Littleton / Variety:
Audible partners with Amazon MGM Studios to co-produce TV series based on Audible Originals content; the titles will be shopped to Prime Video, MGM+, and others  —  Kerry Washington, James Patterson, Aaron Korsh are among the notables on board for new iterations of ‘The Prophecy,’ ‘Daniel X: Genesis,’ ‘Nut Jobs’ and others

item.title: UMGがK-POPマネージメント・エージェンシーHybeと10年間のディストリビューション契約を締結、UMGはHybeのスーパーファン・プラットフォームWeverseへの投資とさらなる協力も行う（Murray Stassen/Music Business Worldwide）
item.description:
Murray Stassen / Music Business Worldwide:
UMG strikes a 10-year distribution deal with K-pop management agency Hybe; UMG also will invest in and further collaborate with Hybe's superfan platform Weverse  —  HYBE has struck what it calls an expanded long-term agreement with Universal Music Group (UMG).

item.title: ボストンの公共ラジオ局WBURが予算の10％削減を目指し、従業員にバイアウトを提案中。
item.description:
Aidan Ryan / The Boston Globe:
Boston public radio station WBUR is offering employees buyouts in an effort to cut ~10% of its budget; CEO says WBUR expects to also cut jobs or freeze hiring  —  The popular public radio station has struggled with a loss in advertising revenue  —  WBUR is offering buyouts to employees …

item.title: ソースG/Oメディアのジム・スパンフェラーCEOは、The A.V. ClubとThe Takeoutの売却をスタッフに告げた。
item.description:
Alexandra Steigrad / New York Post:
Source: G/O Media CEO Jim Spanfeller told staff The A.V. Club and The Takeout have been sold; Paste bought The A.V. Club and Static Media bought The Takeout  —  G/O Media, the struggling company that recently sold Deadspin, is shopping popular humor site The Onion and continued its fire sale …

item.title: ケヴィン・シストロムは、AIニュースアプリ「Artifact」は「想像していたよりもずっと少ないコスト」で運営できるため、当面はオンラインを維持すると述べ、2月の閉鎖時期を撤回した（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
Kevin Systrom says AI news app Artifact will stay online for now due to taking “a lot less to run it than we had imagined”, reversing a February shutdown date  —  Artifact, the well-received AI-powered news app from Instagram's co-founders, Kevin Systrom and Mike Krieger, may not be shutting down as planned.
